sentences.en: A set of doveish appointments could soon dissipate the Fed's inflation - fighting credibility.
sentences.cn: 一系列温和的人事任命可能会不久消除联储抑制通货膨胀的可信度.

sentences.en: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
sentences.cn: 他想明白后，怒气就渐渐消了。

sentences.en: Electromagnets would be used to dissipate the energy of an anti - tank missile.
sentences.cn: 电磁体是用来消散 反 坦克导弹的能量的.

sentences.en: He wound down the windows to dissipate the heat.

sentences.cn: 他的积蓄很快就花完了。

sentences.en: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
sentences.cn: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

sentences.en: Occasionally there would be the days when my depression would dissipate temporarily.
sentences.cn: 偶尔也有这样的日子,我的沮丧之情会暂时消散.

sentences.en: One of the ways to dissipate perspiration is by convection.
sentences.cn: 散发汗水的一种方法是通过对流作用.

sentences.en: Some form of resonator may be used to dissipate energy in an oscillating feed system.
sentences.cn: 某些形式的谐振器可用来耗散供应系统内的振荡能量.

sentences.en: The body must dissipate heat as fast as it produces it.
sentences.cn: 人体散发热量必须和产生热量一样快.

sentences.en: The plunge pool is usually used to dissipate energy under high dam.
sentences.cn: 高坎下游泄洪常常采用水垫塘消能,挑跌水流可能对塘底产生巨大的冲击.

sentences.en: The release of driving very fast would help dissipate what he knew was a dangerous tension.
sentences.cn: 他先把汽车开得非常快,然后渐渐减速.
这一波动随高度增加而衰减.

sentences.en: They dissipate all night and sleep all day.
sentences.cn: 他们白天睡觉,整夜鬼混.

sentences.en: To dissipate the sadness of this recital, Tess went and bade all her favourite cows good - bye.
sentences.cn: 苔丝听了这些故事,自然很伤感,她想把悲哀排遣, 就去外面,向她从前喜欢的那些牛告别.

sentences.en: Trees grow and change and dissipate like their airborne cousins.
sentences.cn: 树会成长、变化、老去,就跟天空的浮云一样.

sentences.en: Vasodilation and sweating dissipate heat through radiation and conduction from the skin.
sentences.cn: 血管舒张和出汗通过皮肤的辐射和传导散热.

words.tran_cn: 消散的；沉迷于酒色的；闲游浪荡的；放荡的

trans.tran_en: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this
to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

trans.tran_cn: 驱散，使消散，浪费，挥霍，耗尽
trans.tran_en: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this
